oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Intercropping strategies for Europe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik
Jensen, Erik Steen
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop combinations and interactions
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In addition to the production of grains rich in protein, grain legumes provide several ‘ecological services’ well suited to the development of sustainable agro-ecosystems. Among these services, N entry to the system via biological N2 fixation and soil fertility building have received most of the attention. However in a system perspective attention should also be paid to others services such as break-crop effect, erosion protection, increasing biodiversity. It is discussed how intercropping can be seen as a cropping strategy worth considering to fullfill the demands mentioned above.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hauggaard-Nielsen, Henrik and Jensen, Erik Steen (2004) Intercropping strategies for Europe. Speech at: 5th European Conference on grain legumes: Legumes for the benefit of agriculture, nutrition and the environment, Palais de Congrès, Dijon, France, 7 -11 June 2004.
